Over de vacature
Je werkt binnen het Data Science team dat verantwoordelijk is voor het bedenken van nieuwe oplossingen, grootschalige data-analyses en high-throughput data processing pipelines. Als Machine Learning Engineer begin je met een aantal kleine concrete projecten en groei je naar het bouwen van complexere systemen. Deze kunnen bestaan uit machine learning model ontwikkeling, deployment & optimalisatie en het ontwerpen en verbeteren van onze interne frameworks en tools. Tijdens je eerste weken on-the-job maak je kennis met onze interne service-based architectuur, data-ecosysteem, datasets en git workflows. Het team zal je helpen met je eerste commits, SSH-config, vragen, refactoring, model design, training en evaluatie. Na deze periode krijg je je eigen project(en) om samen met een teamgenoot aan te werken. Je richt je op het creëren van waarde uit de grote hoeveelheden ongestructureerde schriftelijke informatie die zijn opgeslagen in elektronische zorgdossiers, waarbij je de privacy van de eigenaars nauwlettend in het oog houdt. Je kan denken aan het ontwikkelen van classificatie-, recommender- en information retrieval-systemen of het werken aan ondersteunende tools zoals entity recognition en linking, en de-identificatie. Jouw team Wij zijn een klein ervaren team met een gevarieerde achtergrond variërend van computationele chemie, natuurkunde, artificial intelligence, computer science tot toegepaste wiskunde. We werken binnen een veel grotere software-ontwikkelgroep binnen Nedap Healthcare. Het is makkelijk om dingen voor elkaar te krijgen, omdat we de volledige controle hebben over de hele stack en de producten die we maken. Bovendien is Nedap Healthcare een grote speler op de Nederlandse zorgmarkt en zijn er terabytes aan data die we kunnen gebruiken om de zorg te verbeteren. We discussiëren graag over recente artikelen en publicaties, doen hackathons over geheel nieuwe onderwerpen en kletsen over het leven, het universum en alles.

Niemand houdt dit bij, we vertrouwen hierbij op jouw eigen verantwoordelijkheid. Daarnaast bieden wij jou de middelen om jouw verantwoordelijkheden te vervullen. Ook financieel is het goed geregeld hier. Naast je salaris en vakantiegeld, kent Nedap een 13e maand, een winstuitkering en de mogelijkheid tot aandelen. Ook hebben we een zeer aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling. Persoonlijke ontwikkeling vinden wij erg belangrijk. Jij bepaalt zelf waarin jij je wilt ontwikkelen, wij kennen hiervoor geen vaste potjes. Naast ons uitgebreide introductieprogramma en persoonlijk ontwikkelingstraject, kijken we graag met jou mee naar jouw potentieel. We beschouwen het als een groot pluspunt als je ooit je eigen Linux-kernel hebt gecompileerd, of een paar websites hebt gescraped om je eigen voorspellend model te bouwen. Daarnaast zijn we op zoek naar een kandidaat die kritisch kan denken, pragmatisch kan zijn als dat nodig is en zich lichtelijk ergert als een boekenkast niet goed geordend is. Je werkt op het scherpst van de snede en vertaalt recente ontwikkelingen, soms in samenwerking met een universiteit, naar modellen en producten die een verschil maken. Je hebt ervaring met het ontwikkelen en evalueren van natuurlijke taalverwerkingstechnologie zoals classificatiesystemen of zoeksystemen. We beschouwen het als een groot pluspunt als je ook hands-on bent in het implementeren van deze systemen en ervaring hebt als Software Engineer. Om een concretere indruk te krijgen van onze technologie stack zijn hier een aantal keywords (we verwachten niet dat je alles weet): python, keras, flair, elasticsearch, scikit learn, pytorch, mlflow, ansible, connexion, jupyter lab, pandas, airflow, spacy, parquet.

job data.description_textcontent:
Over de vacature


        
          Een dynamische functie in een dynamische omgeving. Binnen deze organisatie vervul je een belangrijke rol. Die rol de wordt vormgegeven door de volgende werkzaamheden en verantwoordelijkheden:Je ontwerpt en implementeert software besturingsoplossingen voor industriële machines of processen.Je werkt in een speciaal projectteam onder leiding van de Project Manager.Je vertaalt de klantwensen naar een functioneel en/of technisch ontwerp.Je programmeert PLC's en/of SCADA systemen.Je test de functionaliteiten van de nieuwe systemen en voert de inbedrijfstelling uit.Je gedraagt je als de spil tussen de klant en de Project Manager.Incidenteel verblijf je 1 tot 2 weken in het buitenland ten behoeve van inbedrijfstelling. Ben jij een accurate en prestatiegerichte teamplayer, dan is deze technische vacature voor een software engineer geschikt voor jou. Grote kans dat de volgende functie-eisen ook bij jou aansluiten:Je hebt een afgeronde HBO opleiding in de richting van Elektrotechniek of Industriële Automatisering.Je hebt meer dan genoeg ervaring met het programmeren van PLC's in de industriële automatisering.Je hebt de drive om je te verdiepen in Motion.Bij voorkeur heb je ervaring met BoshRexroth en/of Siemens Simotion.Je hebt ervaring met het projectmatig werken.Je hebt het VCA-VOL certificaat.Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs B.Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal goed.Je hebt kennis van NEN13849, NEN 602204 en NEN 3140 Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden

job data.description_textcontent:
Over de vacature


        
          Do you want to enhance society by applying and developing your skills? Do you want to be part of an open network, which connects you with innovative technologies and the brightest & smartest people all around the world?

At Royal HaskoningDHV Digital, we combine the latest digital technologies with over 140 years of engineering experience to help clients in various industry sectors to thrive in this new environment. Our people are keen to positively change the future and leave a legacy. By joining our data science team, you are part of our industry-leading work in AI, software development, predictive modelling, data science, and so much more.

About The Team

Together we have the ambition to realize actionable foresights for smarter designs and better processes within port terminals. Data Science with Impact. Your home will be the data science practice, from which you will work closely with our Smart Ports team (based in the UK & NL) and Digital Twin Suite. We have a growth ambition and stay up to date by closely monitoring the latest developments in our field. We learn from and with each other during our nerd sessions and (mental) boot camps and by attending interesting conventions. In this manner, we maintain our state-of-the-art knowledge and expertise. You also work closely with the Smart Ports team and participate in bi-weekly stand-ups..

The role
We are looking for an experienced data scientist from the maritime sector who, together with our team, wants to take responsibility for realizing data science solutions.

What you bring to the table?
 You have achieved a bachelor or master’s degree in computer sciences, business analytics, AI or similar technical field of study;  For this role you have a broad Python (or R) experience in a consultancy field. With this you position yourself as an expert and you like to take the lead;  You are driven to solve operational and environmental issues in our smart port’s markets independently and with a team;  You have specific experience with and in-depth knowledge of data that’s generated within ports and terminals including a working knowledge of TOS or ERP within a port environment and previous project experience of delivering metrics and analytics projects for terminal operators.  You will be experienced with manipulating large data sets and use them to identify trends and reach meaningful conclusions to inform strategic business decisions.  Experience with design, create, manage or assess an organization’s data architecture.  Within projects you can fulfill the role of lead data scientist or product owner.  Finally, you have demonstrable experience in collaborating within multidisciplinary teams;  For this role you have 3+ years of work experience as a data scientist, machine learning engineer or similar Including development, analytics, reporting and data structure experience with at least one of the following:
 Terminal Operating System; Control Systems/SCADA (equipment control or power management); ERP or Financial Control in similar industry vertical; Equipment, Sensors or Asset monitoring in similar industry vertical;  The belief to do good with data;
 Fluent in English;
 You scrum.


What you will do?
 Working with our maritime domain experts, taking the lead in developing data science approaches for client projects, future solutions or improvement of existing products;
 Apply data science and machine learning in an explorative proof of concept phase within scrum development teams;
 Support in a market approach with your knowledge about the possibilities of data science, machine learning and AI within the smart port’s context, by participating in customer calls and contributing to proposals.


What we offer?
You will work in a professional organization with appealing (inter) national projects and products. You support these projects in a multidisciplinary environment with experts who are leaders in their field. Your work will contribute to enhancing society together. In addition, we offer good primary (min Euro 3200 - max Euro 4230) and secondary employment conditions as well as excellent opportunities for development in both width and depth. For example, we offer an attractive bonus scheme, flexible working conditions and opportunities for international projects, budget and time for personal development and travel opportunities. There is also the possibility to qualify for talent programs at different levels.

The procedure
Interested? Apply now by sending in your CV and motivation letter.


Acquisition as a result of this vacancy is not appreciated.

job data.description_textcontent:
Over de vacature


        
          at GitHub Remote - Europe

GitHub is changing the way the world builds software, and we want you to help build GitHub. We’re looking for a few software engineers to join a passionate, collaborative, distributed group of engineers on our team.

The App Core team improves the availability and performance of GitHub by coordinating cross-org projects and creating tooling to allow engineers to write more resilient code with higher velocity.

Stack: App Core works in all parts of the GitHub stack, including Ruby on Rails, Docker, MySQL, and Golang.

 A day in the life of a team Software Engineer 

Your Typical Week Would Include

Our team is fully remote and distributed across Europe, Canada, and US which means we work asynchronously most of the time.
  Collaborating with engineers throughout GitHub to understand the problems we want to solve, exploring how we can solve them, and what our users have said about the problems and solutions so far   Discussing and collaboratively solving engineering problems with engineering collaborators in GitHub Issues and PRs, Slack, or Zoom   Opening a Pull Request to implement the next most important task, or fix the most critical bug and resolving suggestions in your code reviews   Responding to issues and review requests from other teams at GitHub   Reviewing your teammates’ Pull Requests and providing helpful feedback   Working with your engineering manager in your one-on-one meetings to grow your team and career   Rotating responsibilities for oncall  

Responsibilities
  Pick new work autonomously and code solutions, working to unblock yourself when stuck either by reaching out for help or finding other solutions in an asychronous, remote, distributed culture   Write clear documentation, tests, and recommendations for technical problems   Collaboratively define, scope, prioritize, and estimate work   Drive helpful conversations around technical issues and engineering practices, suggesting improvements and ideas as you see them   Review code and provide thoughtful, constructive feedback during code reviews   Triage, reproduce, and debug issues reported by other coworkers for our areas of responsibility   Give and receive feedback to grow yourself and the team   Provide compassionate technical mentorship, pairing opportunities, and code reviews to encourage the growth of others   Deliver complex code/features with quality and supportability  

Qualifications

There are only a handful of folks who meet all qualifications. We care more about hiring developers that have a track record of caring deeply about shipping software that helps people with their work than checking all of the qualifications off. So whether you meet all the qualifications or a partial set, either way, we want to hear from you.

Minimum Qualifications
  Strong written communication skills   High degree of empathy  3+ years experience as a full-time professional coder   Experience with Ruby on Rails and/or Docker   Familiarity with Git   Ability to learn and think critically about both system design and software engineering concepts and blend those perspectives pragmatically based on project needs  

Preferred Qualifications
  Experience working asynchronously on a remote, distributed team (does not have to be professional experience)  Experience building, operating and maintaining resilient, scalable distributed services   Experience building highly available services at scale   Experience with MySQL or Golang   Knowledge of testing, profiling, and debugging practices  

Who We Are

GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

Leadership Principles

Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness

Why You Should Join

At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here:

We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner.

There are only a handful of folks who meet all qualifications. We care more about hiring developers that have a track record of caring deeply about shipping software that helps people with their work than checking all of the qualifications off. So whether you meet all the qualifications or a partial set, either way, we want to hear from you.

Minimum Qualifications

Strong written communication skills
High degree of empathy
3+ years experience as a full-time professional coder
Experience with Ruby on Rails and/or Docker
Familiarity with Git
Ability to learn and think critically about both system design and software engineering concepts and blend those perspectives pragmatically based on project needs



Preferred Qualifications

Experience working asynchronously on a remote, distributed team (does not have to be professional experience)
Experience building, operating and maintaining resilient, scalable distributed services
Experience building highly available services at scale
Experience with MySQL or Golang
Knowledge of testing, profiling, and debugging practices



Who We Are

GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

Leadership Principles

Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness

Why You Should Join

At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here:

We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner.

GitHub is changing the way the world builds software, and we want you to help build GitHub. We’re looking for a few software engineers to join a passionate, collaborative, distributed group of engineers on our team.

The App Core team improves the availability and performance of GitHub by coordinating cross-org projects and creating tooling to allow engineers to write more resilient code with higher velocity.

Stack: App Core works in all parts of the GitHub stack, including Ruby on Rails, Docker, MySQL, and Golang.

A day in the life of a team Software Engineer

Your Typical Week Would Include

Our team is fully remote and distributed across Europe, Canada, and US which means we work asynchronously most of the time.

Collaborating with engineers throughout GitHub to understand the problems we want to solve, exploring how we can solve them, and what our users have said about the problems and solutions so far
Discussing and collaboratively solving engineering problems with engineering collaborators in GitHub Issues and PRs, Slack, or Zoom
Opening a Pull Request to implement the next most important task, or fix the most critical bug and resolving suggestions in your code reviews
Responding to issues and review requests from other teams at GitHub
Reviewing your teammates’ Pull Requests and providing helpful feedback
Working with your engineering manager in your one-on-one meetings to grow your team and career
Rotating responsibilities for oncall



Responsibilities

Pick new work autonomously and code solutions, working to unblock yourself when stuck either by reaching out for help or finding other solutions in an asychronous, remote, distributed culture
Write clear documentation, tests, and recommendations for technical problems
Collaboratively define, scope, prioritize, and estimate work
Drive helpful conversations around technical issues and engineering practices, suggesting improvements and ideas as you see them
Review code and provide thoughtful, constructive feedback during code reviews
Triage, reproduce, and debug issues reported by other coworkers for our areas of responsibility
Give and receive feedback to grow yourself and the team
Provide compassionate technical mentorship, pairing opportunities, and code reviews to encourage the growth of others
Deliver complex code/features with quality and supportability
